quoteFirst: Willard held the face of his watch to the dim light that came from the open door of the hotel. “
title: Benton's Venture
author: Barbour, Ralph Henry, 1870-1944; Chickering, Charles R. (Charles Ransom), 1891-1970 [Illustrator]

quoteFirst: Of some interest to many is the
quoteLast: accommodation train on the Richmond, Fredericksburg and Potomac Railroad from Ashland to Richmond. It conveys as passengers daily business and professional men to the city.
title: Life Gleanings
author: Macon, T. J. (Thomas Joseph), 1839-1917

quoteLast: --Ever so distant, but quite distinctly, under the thunder of the bombardment I can hear the sound of far-off rifle firing.
title: Letters from France
author: Bean, C. E. W. (Charles Edwin Woodrow), 1879-1968
